doc.field: Mick Moloney Irish-American Music and Popular Culture Papers
Mick Moloney Irish-American Music and Popular Culture Papers

Series VI: Photographs, circa 1930-2002 consists of slides, prints, and negatives of performers, events, and venues that appear in both the Papers and Field Recordings subcollections. Subjects with extensive coverage include Dr. Moloney's performing partnerships with Eugene O'Donnell, Robbie O'Connell, and Jimmy Keane; Moloney's package tours of Ireland and Scotland; the 1987 International Village Fair hosted by Philadelphia's International House; step dancing classes and competitions (some featuring Jean and Cara Butler); and slides prepared for Dr. Moloney's lectures. Of particular note are contact sheets documenting informal gathering of musicians and a 35 mm print of Did Your Mother Come From Ireland?, Dr. Moloney's 1981film on the Mulvihill School of Irish Music in the Bronx.
Mick Moloney Irish-American Music and Popular Culture Papers
